snippet: As fewer customers use banks for routine transactions, back-office spaces have been eliminated and branches have been able to penetrate dense cities.
abstract: Many banks, noting that fewer customers use them for routine transactions, are opening smaller branches with more high-tech tools, getting rid of back-office space, and even vaults, and bringing employees out from behind the counters so that they can circulate with tablets.
lead_paragraph: As fewer customers use banks for routine transactions, back-office spaces have been eliminated and branches have been able to penetrate dense cities.

headline.main: With Technology’s Aid, Banks Squeeze Their Branches Into Smaller Locations
headline.print_headline: With Technology’s Aid, Banks Squeeze Their Branches Into Smaller Locations
